args: Put this article into one of the following categories. Use the most specific category that makes sense. If you are unsure, respond Other. The allowed categories are: Abortion, AI, Associated Press, Birthright citizenship, CFPB, Climate, Crypto, D.C., Debt ceiling, DEI in schools, DEI in the federal government, Department of Education, Deportations, DOGE, End birthright citizenship, Eric Adams case, Expanding executive power, Federal funding, Federal grant pause, Federal office space, Federal worker buyout, Federal workers return to office, Federal workforce reductions, FEMA, Firing government watchdogs, Food safety, Foreign aid, Foreign policy, Gaza, Government shutdown, Guantánamo Bay, Health agencies' communications pause, Health care, Immigration policy, Interest rates, Iran, Islamic State, Israel, Jan. 6, Kennedy Center, NIH, NYC congestion toll, Other, Panama Canal, Pardons, Reclassifying federal jobs, Sanctions, Senior government officials ousted, Taiwan, Targeting political enemies, Targeting protesters, Tariffs, The media, TikTok ban, Transgender policy, U.S.-Mexico border, USAID, USPS, War in Ukraine, World Health Organization Respond ONLY with the category. Trump, Maine Gov. Mills spar over executive order on transgender athletes President Donald Trump and Maine Gov. Janet Mills (D) briefly sparred Friday over the president’s threat to withhold federal funds from her state if it doesn’t comply with a recent executive order barring transgender athletes from competing on women’s sports teams. In a gathering with a group of governors at the White House, Trump began to talk about one of his signature culture war promises when he asked whether anyone among the governors gathered at the White House was from Maine. The Maine Principals’ Association has said it will not enforce his executive order aiming to ban trans athletes from competing in girls’ sports. “You better do it because you’re not going to get federal funding,” Trump said to Mills. “We’re going to follow the law, sir. We’ll see you in court,” she said. “Enjoy your life after governor because I don’t think you’ll be in elected office,” Trump said to the term-limited governor. The back-and-forth followed Trump’s remark Thursday to a group of Republican governors that he would withhold federal funds from Maine unless the state complies with his executive order. In a statement to the Maine Morning Star, Mills responded Friday morning that “the State of Maine will not be intimidated by the president’s threats.”
